#Text=Belgaum
#Text=Belgaum is a city in Northwestern Karnataka , India .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Belgaum got its name from Venugrama meaning Bamboo Village .
#Text=It is the district HQ .
#Text=The most ancient place in the district is Halsi ; and this , once the capital of a dynasty of nine Kadamba kings .
#Text=In 1776 the country was overrun by Hyder Ali of Mysore , but was retaken by the Peshwa with British assistance .
#Text=In 1818 it was handed over to the British East India Company part of Bombay presidency and made district of Sangli state .
#Text=The Divisional headquarters of seven northern Districts of Karnataka and District Headquarters , Belgaum is a picture of contrasts .
#Text=On one side is the old town area where the cotton and silk weavers still create magic with their fingers .
#Text=And on the other the modern , bustling , tree lined Cantonment built by the British .
#Text=Kittur in Belgaum district is a place of historical importance .
#Text=Queen Chennamma of Kittur ( 1778-1829 ) is known for her resistance to British rule ; another person in the history of Belgaum known for his resistance to British rule is Sangolli Rayanna .
#Text=There are several names available for Belgaum city .
#Text=Marathi people call it as Belgaon , Kannada people call Belgavi , South Karnataka people call it as Belagam .
#Text=Belgaum is in the northwestern part of the state of Karnataka , in the southern region of India .
#Text=It lies near the borders of the Indian states of Maharashtra and Goa .
#Text=It is 502 km from Bangalore , 500 km Southeast of Mumbai ( Bombay ) and 125 km southeast of Goa .
#Text=The town is at the foothills of the Sahyadhri range ( Western Ghats ) at an altitude of 25,00 feet ( 779 m ) above sea level .
#Text=The weather of Belgaum is pleasant , owing to its hilly topography .
#Text=Summers ( April – June ) are mildly hot and winters are cool ( November – February ) .
#Text=It experiences heavy southwestern monsoon rains during ( July – September ) .
#Text=It receives as much as 50 inches of rain annually .
#Text=By road

#Text=Belgaum is connected by road via the National Highway #4 ( connecting Maharashtra[ Now part of the Golden Quadrilateral ] , Karnataka , Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu ) and NH-4A ( connecting Karnataka and Goa ) .
#Text=There are a number of Bus operators plying between
#Text=a ) Mumbai - Belgaum
#Text=b ) Pune - Belgaum
#Text=c ) Bangalore - Belgaum
#Text=d ) Hyderabad - Belgaum
#Text=Some of the prominent bus operators are - VRL ( Vijayanand Road Lines ) , Pai Travels , Barde Travels , PVG
#Text=By train

#Text=Belgaum is on the main Indian Railways grid being part of Hubli-Division and is well connected by rail to major destinations such as Bangalore ( via Hubli ) , Mumbai , Pune/Delhi ( via Miraj ) and Goa .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Belgaum has excellent city bus connectivity and also for the rural area around Belgaum , the charges are nominal around ₹10 from one end to the other part of the city .
#Text=Private and Gov't Buses also provide transport for commuting between Hubli , Dharwad , Goa , and other nearby places .
#Text=By autorickshaw
#Text=This is cheap way of transport between attractions .
#Text=Though not metered always it would be wise to ask the approximate amount from a local .
#Text=By taxi
#Text=Normally , Taxis are not needed unless you plan to go way out of the city .
#Text=If you want to move around in City , Autos and Buses are good enough .
#Text=By car
#Text=There are many rental companies offering cars with drivers or self-drive .
#Text=Hertz : College Road , Belgaum
#Text=See
#Text=The old stone fort , built in 12th century ad by the local Ratta rulers , is an important spot , though hardly anything of the original structure remains .
#Text=One can view the splendid Kamal Basti ( Jain temple ) , within the fort 's premises .
#Text=The Fort premises also hosts the Sri Ramakrishna Mission Ashram .
#Text=This fort was renovated and built on by successive rulers who ruled Belgaum from time to time .
#Text=Belgaum 's Watchtower and Sunset Point should not be missed if one wants to savor the scenic beauty surrounding this small town .

#Text=Belgaum is famous for its temples and the religious-minded traveler could find a number of temples here , the main ones being Kamal Basti ( in Belgaum Fort ) Kapileshwar temple , Shani temple and the Maruti Temple .

#Text=A number of religious monuments are located within the cantonment area-the Masjid-Sata mosque , which dates back to the 16th century AD , the Mahadeva temple with its beautiful gardens , the St. Mary 's Church of England , St. Xavier 's Church , Catholic Cathedral and St. Anthony 's Church , all lie within the lush green environs of the Cantonment .
#Text=Do
#Text=Trekking around Jamboti and Amboli ghats .
#Text=White water Rafting on the Kali Nadi .
#Text=Paragliding activities around Belgaum ( NCC ) .
#Text=Eat
#Text=The cuisine also has a mixed flavour of central(Marathi)and north Indian flavours .
#Text=This would be the place to try Chats and other Maharashtrian delicacies in Karnataka .
#Text=Ajanta cafe is excellent for its Puri Bhaaji , Dosa 's and Spl Chai .
#Text=Aadinarayan , Kirloskar Road ( Bogar ves ) .
#Text=Famous for Fish
#Text=Hotel Aadinarayan , Kirloskar Road ( Bogar ves ) .
#Text=Famous for Fresh sea food
#Text=among the recently opened favorite joints for ice cream is Natural ice cream of juhu scheme .
#Text=It has its outlet at Nehru Nagar near KLE medical in Belgaum .
#Text=The shop is open from 10:30AM till late at night and is a delight for all ice cream lovers .
#Text=If you are Tea lover then you should visit appolo tea bar near central Bus Stand .
#Text=The veg-patty & the cream rolls are amzing here .
#Text=Belgaum special sweet , e.g. at Kalyani Sweets in Camp .
#Text=Solkadi a drink made from Kokam fruits is also a Goan import goes well with fish .
#Text=Pav
#Text=Bhaji from Shetty Snacks and chat center in front of Aditya Arcade near Ramdev Hotel .
#Text=Dhabeli from Sharma hotel on Kirloskar Road .

#Text=Pai Resort : Pai Resort is located at 3 km from Belgaum ( Karnataka , India ) City Centre and 8 km from Airport .
